Description: Body sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery neck-amphora; from left, outspread wing of bird or siren with added red and white bands and white dots; siren (part of white head, chest, wing with red and white bands and dots in white and part of body remaining), to left.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels, see Cambridge Fitzwilliam GR.300b.1899 and GR.43.1894.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 38, no. 8, pl. XIX, no. 8)
Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 125, no. 15)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 253, no. 5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.089) (phase 3)
